# INCancelRideIntentResponse

**Class**

Your app’s response to a cancel ride intent.

## Declaration

```swift
class INCancelRideIntentResponse
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INCancelRideIntentResponse] object contains your app’s response to the cancellation of a ride. After creating the response object, specify any cancellation-related fees using the properties of this object. Siri and Maps display your response information to the user during the confirmation phase.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INCancelRideIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INCancelRideIntentHandling/confirm(cancelRide:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INCancelRideIntentHandling/handle(cancelRide:completion:)] methods of your handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INCancelRideIntentHandling].

## Initializing the Response Object

- **init(code:userActivity:)**: Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Getting the Response Code

- **code**: The code indicating whether you successfully handled the intent.
- **INCancelRideIntentResponseCode**: Constants indicating the state of the response.

## Specifying Cancellation Fees

- **cancellationFee**: The cancellation fee charged by your service.
- **cancellationFeeThreshold**: The amount of time that must elapse before cancellation fees apply.

## Cancel Ride

- **INCancelRideIntentHandling**: The handler interface for canceling a previously booked ride.
- **INCancelRideIntent**: An intent requesting the cancellation of a previously booked ride.

## Inherits From

- INIntentResponse

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
